description.narrative: By 2015, improved policies, practices and services to effectively prevent and respond to unnecessary institutionalization of children (especially children under three and children with disabilities), which contributes to Child Protection Systems, Prevention And Response Services For Violence Against Children. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2015, there is an increase in the proportion of vulnerable children who benefit from alternative community-based social services, family substitute care and alternatives to incarceration.

sector.narrative: ECD data, evidence, and knowledge generation and dissemination
Ending violence against women and girls
Justice, law and order policy, planning and administration
Legal and policy framework related to violence, exploitation and abuse
Promoting diversion and alternatives to deprivation of liberty
Social protection and welfare services policy, planning and administration
Social welfare workforce systems strengthening (accreditation, staffing and supervision)

description.narrative: Social Protection, Land Housing and Community Amenities policy, planning and administration

title.narrative: UNICEF Policy on Harmonized Approach to Cash Transfers to Implementing Partners
UNICEF Procedure on Harmonized Approach to Cash Transfers to Implementing Partners
UNICEF procedure for programme implementation partnerships
UNICEF Contract Awards through the UN Global Marketplace
Tajikistan 2020 Annual Report on Results for Children
UNICEF Tender Notices through the UN Global Marketplace

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By 2015, improved policies, practices and services to effectively prevent and respond to unnecessary institutionalization of children (especially children under three and children with disabilities)
Number of children in baby homes

baseline.value: 285 in 4 baby homes (Sofia 2012 Statement by DPM)

title.narrative: Basic package of child protection services defined and implemented by the responsible government agencies
Provision of Community Based Rehabilitation (CBR) for Children with Disabilities (CWD) in 15 districts in Khatlon Province

baseline.value: No CWD reached through CBR in Khatlon (2010)

title.narrative: A Law on Child Protection/ Child Rights Code is developed in line with international standards.

Existence of a regular in -service, pre-service training on Social Work (SW)

baseline.value: TNU SW department offering BSW with no standard internship practice No formal certificate /in service programs for social workers
